result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley A Kleikamp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

DNA Sample.
Mental health evaluation and follow through with recommendations.
No contact with victim.
Domestic violence assessment and follow through with recommendations.
Parenting course.
Counseling as deemed necessary by agent.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: 03:05 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim and Reporter by Zoom.  Plea agreement.  State makes record regarding filing of information 2 days beyond deadline.  Def. does not ask to dismiss and wants to move forward today.  On plea to Cts. 2 and 3, State asks Ct. 1 be dismissed & read in.  Ct. 2 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, mental health evaluation & follow through with recommendations, no contact with victim, domestic violence assessment and treatment, parenting class, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 3 - 75 days jail, costs.  Victim rights complied with.  Plea questionnaire and waiver of rights form filed.  Court reviews with Def.  Ct. 2 - guilty plea.  Ct. 3 - guilty plea.  Court grants motion to dismiss and read in Ct. 1 for sentencing purposes.  Court advises Def. of constitutional rights and right to jury trial.  Def. waives rights and jury trial.  Def.'s Atty. advises Court he has an incorrect penalty on the plea questionnaire.  Court advises Def. of elements and penalties.  Def. advised of possible deportation if not US citizen.  Court finds pleas entered freely and voluntarily.  Factual basis.  Court accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of Ct. 2 and Ct. 3.  Victim makes statement to the Court.  Sentencing remarks by State.  Sentencing remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Victim makes statement to Court.  Further remarks by Def.'s Atty.  Def. makes statement to Court.  Court orders:  Ct. 2 - sentence withheld, 3 years probation, costs, DNA sample and surcharge, mental health evaluation & follow through with recommendations, no contact with victim, domestic violence assessment and follow through with recommendations, parenting course, counseling as deemed necessary by agent.  Ct. 3 - 120 days jail, huber, good time credit, costs, DNA surcharge.  Pay in full or payment plan to be started 30 days from release date.  Credit 63 days.  Def. advised of voting and firearm rights.  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Def. advised of postconviction rights.  Credit on Ct. 3.  Jail to commmence immediately.
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 13, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

02:03 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley A Kleikamp appeared by video means with Attorney.  Parties and reporter by Zoom.  Information is being filed at this time.  Def. makes motion to dismiss.  Bond continued.  Motion hearing scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

01:00 PM Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley A Kleikamp appeared by video means with Attorney. All parties via zoom.  Atty Zich advise court def. is waiving p.h.  Court goes over waiver of preliminary hearing examination with def.   Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing and request speedy trial.  Atty Zich makes statement. Victim appears via zoom.  Court accepts waiver and finds probable cause and binds over. DA is withdrawing Information as this is ADA case and ADA will need to be present for Arraignment.  Atty Zich heard on issues. State has complied with victim rights.  Arraignment scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:51 PM  Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appeared via Zoom.  Attorney Zich gives bail bond argument and requests bail bond signature.  Court questions Attorney Zich.  ADA gives bail bond argument and objects. 3:56 PM victim joins court and gives statement.  Court gives ruling.  Court denies bail bond modifications. Bail bond will remain in the amount of $3,000. With previous conditions. Preliminary hearing is previously scheduled.  Court is adjourned.

02:19 PM Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court with attorney John Zich.  Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in custody, via zoom.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin, via zoom.  Bradley A Kleikamp appeared by video means with Attorney. Atty Zich has copy of complaint, waives reading and reserve rights and request timely p.h. Bond Continues  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: 01:38 PM Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley A Kleikamp appeared by video means. Def. was denied for P.D. and is still waiting for court appointed atty. CC advise def.  needs to complete Petition for court appointed atty.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No contact with alleged victim or alleged victims residence.  No use or possession of firearms.

10:27 AM Defendant Bradley A Kleikamp in court, in custody.  Kelly L Hays appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bradley A Kleikamp appeared by video means. All parties via zoom.    Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty. Def. is going to reach out to P.D. State would like to history with Langlade Co. Def. makes statement. Court questions defendant. Response by defendant. State gives bail/bond recommendations with conditions.  Def. heard on bond. Court gives ruling & orders $3,000 cash bond with conditions no contact with alleged victims or residence or .  No use or possession of firearms.  Court will reserve to be heard on bond @ later date. Court adjourns @ 10:37 am.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
